discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/cloudwatch_concepts.html

Selected Answer: A
CloudWatch allows users to send data points with timestamps up to two weeks (1,209,600 seconds) in the future. So, sending data 90 minutes in the future is within the permissible timeframe. CloudWatch will accept the data and process it according to the specified timestamp.
Correct Answer: A
A. CloudWatch will accept the data

questions.question_text: A user is sending the data to CloudWatch using the CloudWatch API. The user is sending data 90 minutes in the future. What will CloudWatch do in this case?
questions.answer_description: With Amazon CloudWatch, each metric data point must be marked with a time stamp. The user can send the data using CLI but the time has to be in the UTC format. If the user does not provide the time, CloudWatch will take the data received time in the UTC timezone. The time stamp sent by the user can be up to two weeks in the past and up to two hours into the future.

choices.D: The user cannot send data for more than 60 minutes in the future
choices.B: It is not possible to send data of the future
choices.C: It is not possible to send the data manually to CloudWatch

questions.question_text: A user wants to upload a complete folder to AWS S3 using the S3 Management console. How can the user perform this activity?

discussion.content: I tested with Recursive folders and files..Not seen any enable Enhanced Folder option. Just done drag and drop which uploaded all successfully.

Answer is A. You can drag and drop on console without any changes.
Maybe D is outdated version.

Selected Answer: A
In the AWS S3 Management Console, you can easily upload a complete folder by dragging and dropping it directly into the console. The console provides a convenient interface that allows you to drag and drop folders and files to upload them to your S3 bucket. This is a user-friendly way to upload multiple objects at once without having to manually upload each file individually.

Opt A.

choices.B: Use the Enable Enhanced Folder option from the S3 console while uploading objects

choices.A: Just drag and drop the folder using the flash tool provided by S3
choices.D: Use the Enable Enhanced Uploader option from the S3 console while uploading objects

questions.answer_description:
AWS S3 provides a console to upload objects to a bucket. The user can use the file upload screen to upload the whole folder in one go by clicking on the Enable
Enhanced Uploader option. When the user uploads a folder, Amazon S3 uploads all the files and subfolders from the specified folder to the user's bucket. It then assigns a key value that is a combination of the uploaded file name and the folder name.

discussion.content: Correct Answer: C
C. Transaction Log

questions.question_text: Which of the below mentioned AWS RDS logs cannot be viewed from the console for MySQL?
questions.answer_description:
The user can view, download, and watch the database logs using the Amazon RDS console, the Command Line Interface (CLI., or the Amazon RDS API. For the
MySQL RDS, the user can view the error log, slow query log, and general logs. RDS does not support viewing the transaction logs.

questions.question_text:
A user has launched an EBS backed EC2 instance in the US-East-1a region. The user stopped the instance and started it back after 20 days. AWS throws up an
`ËœInsufficientInstanceCapacity' error. What can be the possible reason for this?

choices.D: The user account has reached the maximum EC2 instance limit
choices.C: There is some issue with the host capacity on which the instance is launched
choices.A: AWS does not have sufficient capacity in that availability zone
choices.B: AWS zone mapping is changed for that user account

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When an EC2 instance is stopped and then started after a period of time, it relies on the availability of sufficient underlying capacity in the specified availability zone. In this case, if AWS does not have enough capacity available in the US-East-1a availability zone, it will result in the InsufficientInstanceCapacity error.

Selected Answer: A
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-insufficient-capacity-errors/

Selected Answer: A
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52113153/ec2-error-starting-instances-insufficient-capacity#:~:text=According%20to%20the%20documentation%2C%20getting,without%20specifying%20an%20availability%20zone

choices.C: The user has to manually create a NAT instance
choices.B: VPC bounds the main route table with a private subnet and a custom route table with a public subnet
choices.D: VPC bounds the main route table with a public subnet and a custom route table with a private subnet
choices.A: The AWS VPC will automatically create a NAT instance with the micro size

questions.question_text: A user has created a VPC with public and private subnets using the VPC wizard. Which of the below mentioned statements is true in this scenario?
questions.answer_description:
A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is a virtual network dedicated to the user's AWS account. A user can create a subnet with VPC and launch instances inside that subnet. If the user has created a public private subnet, the instances in the public subnet can receive inbound traffic directly from the internet, whereas the instances in the private subnet cannot. If these subnets are created with Wizard, AWS will create a NAT instance of a smaller or higher size, respectively. The
VPC has an implied router and the VPC wizard updates the main route table used with the private subnet, creates a custom route table and associates it with the public subnet.

discussion.content: My vote goes to B.

Answer: B

Answer was A, if Nat instance was configured with Instance sizing but in an option A, they have mentioned "Automatically create instance with micro size"

comments.content: Actually it creates a NAT gateway, not a NAT instance anymore
Yes, it does. I have done it several times.

discussion.content: Can someone please confirm whether a Custom VPC and a Public Subnet created using a VPC Wizard creates an automatic NAT instance or not? :|
B. VPC bounds the main route table with a private subnet and a custom route table with a public subnet
